long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Optimize and analyze any webpage with the most powerful SEO toolkit, directly from your browser.

SEO Specialist Extension is the ultimate companion for SEO professionals, delivering quick and actionable insights. From metadata and headings to structured data and link analysis, this extension streamlines your SEO workflow with precision.

Key Features:
‚úÖ Comprehensive Metadata Analysis
‚Ü≥ Extract the title, meta description, canonical URL, meta robots, and full page URL.
‚Ü≥ Get real-time validation: Check if title and description lengths align with SEO best practices.

‚úÖ Advanced Heading Structure
‚Ü≥ Explore H1 to H6 tags in detail, including content and hierarchy position.
‚Ü≥ Visual Highlights: Instantly identify and troubleshoot heading issues directly on the page.

‚úÖ Link Analysis & Classification
‚Ü≥ Get a complete breakdown of internal vs. external links and dofollow vs. nofollow.
‚Ü≥ Visually highlight links on the page to quickly identify link attributes and opportunities.

‚úÖ Hreflang Checker
‚Ü≥ Extract and analyze hreflang attributes to ensure multilingual SEO compatibility.
‚Ü≥ Get a clear table of alternate language versions and their respective URLs.

‚úÖ Structured Data (Schema) Validator
‚Ü≥Detect and validate JSON-LD structured data.
‚Ü≥Quickly test with Schema.org Validator and Google Rich Results Test in one click.
Easily copy structured data for deeper analysis.

‚úÖ Enhanced Word Density Analysis
‚Ü≥Analyze word frequency, density, and key text metrics:
    -Word count
    -Characters (with/without spaces)
    -Number of paragraphs
‚Ü≥ Get a list of the 10 most frequent words while filtering out common stopwords in multiple languages (English, Spanish, Catalan, Galician, and Basque).

‚úÖ Quick Access to Sitemap & Robots.txt
‚Ü≥Direct links to sitemap.xml and robots.txt for easier crawling diagnostics.
‚Ü≥Includes a link to check the rendered version of the page using Browseo.net.

‚úÖ Validation Shortcuts
‚Ü≥Instantly test your page with Google‚Äôs "site:" search query to check indexed content.
